\title{PHYS Simulation API}
\date{Oct 22, 2020}

\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


Using PHYS Simulation API you can request simulations of some physical or
mathematical systems such as the \sphinxhref{https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonic\_oscillator}{Harmonic Oscillator} or the
\sphinxhref{https://doi.org/10.1016/j.chaos.2003.12.034}{Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee Attractor} \textendash{}and soon many others, stay tuned!


\chapter{History}
\label{\detokenize{index:history}}
PHYS Simulation API started as a way of learning to develop an API.
We believe that the best way of learning is by doing. This way, we chose
a topic that drives us (yes, physics and mathematics!) and started learning by
writting code! Of course, we had to read a lot and fail a lot as well, but
we managed to develop our very first web application and we are proud of it, as
impefect as it may be.

In the future we want to add as many features as we can, so far it enriches
the client experience.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This project was also presented as Harvard’s CS50x final project. Check out
the \sphinxhref{https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2QGRTdbjzLU}{video}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\chapter{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{index:getting-started}}

\section{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:overview}}\label{\detokenize{start/overview:start-overview}}\label{\detokenize{start/overview::doc}}
In PHYS Simulation API you can request \textendash{}via HTTP POST method\textendash{} a simulation from
a list of available simulations. Here we will show you the schemas you need to
appropiately request your simulation. In {\hyperref[\detokenize{start/examples:start-examples}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Examples}}}} you
will see how this works in the real life.


\subsection{Request a simulation}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:request-a-simulation}}
The simulation requests are made in route \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/simulate/\{sim\_system\}}},
where \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_system}} is one of the members of
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}.

The body of the request must abide by the following schema


\subsubsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{SimRequest}}}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:simrequest}}

The body of the HTML response will have the following schema

\label{\detokenize{start/overview:simidresponse}}\label{\detokenize{start/overview:id1}}

\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}


\subsection{Request Simulation Status}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:request-simulation-status}}
The response of the request simulation ({\hyperref[\detokenize{start/overview:simidresponse}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{SimIdResponse}}}})
contains a simulation ID, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_id}}. In order to know the simulation status you
just need to make an HTTP request via GET with empty body in route
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/request/status/\{sim\_id\}}}.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The route will be availble just after the simulation is finished. If you do
not receive a successful response and you are sure about the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_id}} you
provided in the API route, the simulation may still be in course.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

The schema of the response will be the following


\subsubsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{SimStatus}}}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:simstatus}}\label{\detokenize{start/overview:id2}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxatlongtablestart\begin{longtable}[c]{|*{6}{\X{1}{6}|}}
\hline

\endfirsthead

\multicolumn{6}{c}%
{\makebox[0pt]{\sphinxtablecontinued{\tablename\ \thetable{} \textendash{} continued from previous page}}}\\
\hline

\endhead

\hline
\multicolumn{6}{r}{\makebox[0pt][r]{\sphinxtablecontinued{continues on next page}}}\\
\endfoot

\endlastfoot

\subsection{Request Results}
\label{\detokenize{start/overview:request-results}}
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{success=True}} in {\hyperref[\detokenize{start/overview:simstatus}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{SimStatus}}}}, you can
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxtitleref{Directly download your results}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\alph}{enumii}{enumiii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Download pickle file with all the simulation results as returned by
\sphinxhref{https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp.html}{scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp}. You can do this via GET with empty body
in route \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/results/\{sim\_id\}/pickle}}.

\item {} 
Download your simulation’s automatically generated plots. You can do this
via GET with empty body in route
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/results/\{sim\_id\}/plot?value=\{plot\_query\_value\}}}, where
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_value}} is one of the items in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_values}} in the
simulation status, {\hyperref[\detokenize{start/overview:simstatus}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{SimStatus}}}}.

\end{enumerate}

\item {} 
\sphinxtitleref{See your results online}. You can do this via GET in route
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/results/\{sim\_system\}/\{sim\_id\}}}. In the rendered HTML file, you have the
option to download both the generated plots and the pickle file mentioned in
the last item.

\end{enumerate}


\section{Install and run PHYS Simulation}
\label{\detokenize{start/install:install-and-run-phys-simulation}}\label{\detokenize{start/install:start-install}}\label{\detokenize{start/install::doc}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Before installing PHYS Simulation make sure you \sphinxhref{https://pypi.org/project/pipenv/}{install pipenv}.

\item {} 
To download PHYS Simulation clone it from the github repository using the
following command

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} git clone https://github.com/jearistiz/phys\PYGZus{}simulation
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
Change to the directory where PHYS Simulation is installed

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} \PYG{n+nb}{cd} phys\PYGZus{}simulation
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
Create a virtual environment and install all the requirements using
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pipenv}} (this can take several minutes)

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} pipenv install
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
Activate the virtual environment

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} pipenv shell
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
Finally, run the web application in your localhost \sphinxurl{http://0.0.0.0:5700/}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} pipenv run simulation\PYGZus{}api
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

You can manage \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HOST}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PORT}} variables in the server configuration
file \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciitilde{}/phys\_simulation/config.py}}.

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The project runs on a Uvicorn server. The file in charge of setting up and
starting the server is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciitilde{}/phys\_simulation/run.py}}. Change the options to
your prefferred ones.

\item {} 
If you run the server locally you can try the frontend and API in the host
and port you chose. The frontend is almost self\sphinxhyphen{}explanatory.

\item {} 
If you want to try out the API, go to the {\hyperref[\detokenize{start/examples:start-examples}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Examples}}}}
section. We also explain how to use the API in general terms in the
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/overview:start-overview}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Overview}}}} section.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{The API has its own client documentation}, thanks to FastAPI’s
integration with Swagger (formerly OpenAPI). To read this docs, after
starting the server go to the resource \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{localhos:5700/docs}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{localhos:5700/redoc}} and refer to the documentation of the resources
starting with  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/}}.

\item {} 
If you want to stop the server, go to the terminal where you started it and
use the shortcut \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Ctrl + C}}.

\item {} 
If you want to remove the virtual environment after using the app move to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciitilde{}/phys\_simulation/}} directory and execute

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} pipenv \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}rm
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{itemize}
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\section{Examples}
\label{\detokenize{start/examples:examples}}\label{\detokenize{start/examples:start-examples}}\label{\detokenize{start/examples::doc}}
Here we will see an example of the work flow with PHYS Simulation API. To make
HTTP requests we will use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{requests}} Python library.

Let’s see our API in action!


\subsection{1. Request Simulation}
\label{\detokenize{start/examples:request-simulation}}
Lets start with some imports and defining our simulation request body.

Note that \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_request}} follows the pydantic model
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_API.controller.schemas.SimRequest}}. For the
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ChenLeeAttractor}}, the initial
condition array is of length 3, and the parameters are
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{a}},
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{b}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{c}}. In your
case, the conditions may be different, so you must check what are the parameters
and what are the initial conditions for the system you want to simulate.

Now we request the simulation via post to the appropiate route and print the
result

how to request the simulation results.


\subsection{2. Request Simulation Status}
\label{\detokenize{start/examples:request-simulation-status}}
We proceed now to request the simulation results via GET in route
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/simulate/status/\{sim\_id\}}}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Example: Simulation Status \PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}}

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{    \PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{HTML status code: 200}
\PYG{g+go}{Response:}
\PYG{g+go}{    \PYGZob{}}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}sim\PYGZus{}id\PYGZsq{}: e5f6d0e0719b45fea4aa9f098e12e7c3,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}user\PYGZus{}id\PYGZsq{}: 1,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}date\PYGZsq{}: 2020\PYGZhy{}10\PYGZhy{}05T23:31:24.977484,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}system\PYGZsq{}: Chen\PYGZhy{}Lee\PYGZhy{}Attractor,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}ini\PYGZus{}cndtn\PYGZsq{}: [10.0, 10.0, 0.0],}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}params\PYGZsq{}: \PYGZob{}\PYGZsq{}a\PYGZsq{}: 3.0, \PYGZsq{}b\PYGZsq{}: \PYGZhy{}5.0, \PYGZsq{}c\PYGZsq{}: \PYGZhy{}1.0\PYGZcb{},}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}method\PYGZsq{}: RK45,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}pickle\PYGZsq{}: /api/results/e5f6d0e0719b45fea4aa9f098e12e7c3/pickle,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}results\PYGZsq{}: /api/simulate/status/e5f6d0e0719b45fea4aa9f098e12e7c3,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}plots\PYGZsq{}: /api/results/e5f6d0e0719b45fea4aa9f098e12e7c3/plot,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}values\PYGZsq{}: [\PYGZsq{}threeD\PYGZsq{}, \PYGZsq{}project\PYGZsq{}],}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}receipe\PYGZsq{}: \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}plots\PYGZsq{} + \PYGZsq{}?value=\PYGZsq{} + \PYGZsq{}plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}value\PYGZsq{},}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}success\PYGZsq{}: True,}
\PYG{g+go}{        \PYGZsq{}message\PYGZsq{}: Finished. You can request via GET: download simulation results (pickle) in route given in \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}pickle\PYGZsq{}, or; download plots of simulation in route \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}plots\PYGZsq{} using query params the ones given in \PYGZsq{}plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}values\PYGZsq{}, or; see results online in route \PYGZsq{}route\PYGZus{}results\PYGZsq{}.,}
\PYG{g+go}{    \PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Note the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sleep(5)}} call at the beginning of this code block. We did this in
order to be sure that the simulation was completed. If we request the simulation
status too soon, it may not be available and an appropiate \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{message}} will be
returned in the response as well as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"success": False}}.

Also note that in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"message"}} it is clearly stated how to access the
results.


\subsection{3. Request Simulation Results}
\label{\detokenize{start/examples:request-simulation-results}}
Now we proceed to download the pickle and the plots, as stated in the
simulation status \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"message"}}.

Lets start with the pickle

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Example: GET Results \PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{sim\PYGZus{}status\PYGZus{}response\PYGZus{}json}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{success}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Warning: pickle and plot files not available.}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{n}{sys}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{exit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}}

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{n}{file}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pickle\PYGZus{}response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{content}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The generated file is named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation.pickle}} and contains all the
information of the simulation results.

Finally, lets download the plots

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Plots download route}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{plots\PYGZus{}route} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sim\PYGZus{}status\PYGZus{}response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{json}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{route\PYGZus{}plots}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}

\section{Website}
\label{\detokenize{start/frontend:website}}\label{\detokenize{start/frontend:start-frontend}}\label{\detokenize{start/frontend::doc}}
This API has a very simple frontend, where you can request your simulations and
see all the available results, as well as some pretty plots of each simulation.

Right now we are not serving online, but plan to do so some day. If you want to
run the frontend and API locally in your machine please go to the section
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/install:start-install}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Install and run PHYS Simulation}}}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/overview:start-overview}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Overview}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/install:start-install}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Install and run locally}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/examples:start-examples}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Examples}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{start/frontend:start-frontend}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Website}}}}

\end{itemize}


\chapter{For Developers}
\label{\detokenize{index:for-developers}}
This API is built on top of \sphinxhref{https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi}{FastAPI}. If you want to contribute to this
project, you may find \sphinxhref{https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/}{their docs} very useful.

In this section you can find all the source code docuentation. If you have a
question on how some function, class or method works, maybe it’s answered here.
If not, do not hesitate to \sphinxhref{mailto:jeaz.git@gmail.com}{contact us}.

\index{api\_simulate\_sim\_system() (in module simulation\_api.controller.main)@\spxentry{api\_simulate\_sim\_system()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.main}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.main.api_simulate_sim_system}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{async }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.main.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{api\_simulate\_sim\_system}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_system}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_params}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{background\_tasks}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{starlette.background.BackgroundTasks}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{db}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Depends(get\_db)}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}}}}}
In this route the client can request a simulation.

When the client requests a simulation via \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/simulate/\{sim\_system\}}},
he/she obtains relevant information on how to get the results of the
simulation.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Here we use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.BackgroudTasks}} to make the simulation in the
background.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_system}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}) \textendash{} System to be simulated.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_params}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimRequest}}}}}) \textendash{} Simulation request information with schema given by SimRequest and
decalared in schemas.py.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{background\_tasks}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{BackgroundTasks}}) \textendash{} Background task FastAPI manager (Class). This is handled internally.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{db}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Session}}) \textendash{} Database Session, needed to interact with database. This is handled
internally.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{sim\_id\_response} \textendash{} Contains relevant information about the simulation and how to get the
results.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}]{\sphinxcrossref{SimIdResponse}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{simulate\_sim\_system\_post() (in module simulation\_api.controller.main)@\spxentry{simulate\_sim\_system\_post()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.main}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.main.simulate_sim_system_post}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{async }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.main.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{simulate\_sim\_system\_post}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{request}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{starlette.requests.Request}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_system}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{background\_tasks}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{starlette.background.BackgroundTasks}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{db}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Depends(get\_db)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_sys}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}}}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{username}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{t0}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tf}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{dt}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{t\_steps}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{int} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{method}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.IntegrationMethods}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.IntegrationMethods}}}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Form(Ellipsis)}}}{}
Receives the simulation request information from the frontend form and
requests the simulation to the backend.

This route receives the form requesting a simulation (filled in
frontend via GET in route \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/simulate/\{sim\_system\}}}). The simulation is
internally requested using the function
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._api_simulation_request}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks.\_api\_simulation\_request()}}}}}.
Finally the client is redirected to the “Simulation ID” frontend web
page, where further information about the simulation is displayed.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Request}}) \textendash{} HTTP request, used internally by FastAPI.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_system}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}) \textendash{} System to be simulated.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{background\_tasks}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{BackgroundTasks}}) \textendash{} Needed to request simulation to the backend (in background). Handled
internally by the API.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{db}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Session}}) \textendash{} Database Session, needed to interact with database. This is handled
internally.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_sys}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}) \textendash{} Form entry: system to be simulated. Must be one of the members of
SimSystem.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{username}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Form entry: name of the user requesting the simulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Form entry: initial time of simulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tf}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Form entry: final time of simulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Form entry: timestep of simulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t\_steps}} \textendash{} Form entry: number of time steps. If different from 0 or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}},
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dt}} is ignored.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{method}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.IntegrationMethods}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{IntegrationMethods}}}}}) \textendash{} Form entry: method of integration. Must be a member of
IntegrationMethods.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
If the client made a mistake filling the form renders the simulation
request form again. Otherwise, redirects the client to “Simulation ID”
frontend web page.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.templating.Jinja2Templates.TemplateResponse}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{starlette.responses.RedirectResponse}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The values of the form accessed by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.Form}} are only
declared as parameters so that pydantic checks the types, but they are not
used directly to request the simulation.
Here, we access the form directly
by using the method \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.Request.form()}} as can be seen in the
first lines of this function. This allows us a better control over the data
and also to handle different type of forms \textendash{}which depend on the simulation
because parameters and initial conditions are intrinsically different for
different systems.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{simulate\_status\_sim\_id() (in module simulation\_api.controller.main)@\spxentry{simulate\_status\_sim\_id()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.main}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.main.simulate_status_sim_id}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{async }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.main.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{simulate\_status\_sim\_id}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{request}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{starlette.requests.Request}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_id}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{db}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{Depends(get\_db)}}}{}
Shows simulation status for a given simulation via its \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_id}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Request}}) \textendash{} HTTP request, used internally by FastAPI.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} ID of the simulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{db}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Session}}) \textendash{} Database Session, needed to interact with database. This is handled
internally.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Template displaying the simulation status and a hyperlinks to
simulation results in several formats. If simulation id is not
available (not yet in database), renders a message about the situation.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.templating.Jinja2Templates.TemplateResponse}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:module-simulation_api.controller.schemas}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation-api-controller-schemas}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!simulation\_api.controller.schemas@\spxentry{simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}\index{simulation\_api.controller.schemas@\spxentry{simulation\_api.controller.schemas}!module@\spxentry{module}}
This module defines all the models/schemas needed in our application, except
the database models required for sqlalchemy ORM.

\index{IntegrationMethods (class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas)@\spxentry{IntegrationMethods}\spxextra{class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.IntegrationMethods}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{IntegrationMethods}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{value}}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enum.Enum}}

List of available integration methods

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
For more information about these integration methods see
\sphinxhref{https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp.html}{scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
Please update this class with relvant simulation methods available in
\sphinxhref{https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp.html}{scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp} \textendash{}only the ones that do not require more
parameters than the ones provided in
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimRequest}}}}}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\index{PlotQueryValues (in module simulation\_api.controller.schemas)@\spxentry{PlotQueryValues}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}

\index{PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee (class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas)@\spxentry{PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee}\spxextra{class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues_ChenLee}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{value}}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enum.Enum}}

List of tags of each different plot generated automatically by the
backend when a Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee simulation is requested.

These tags are used as the possible values of the querry param \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{value}}
in route \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/results/\{sim\_id\}/plot?value=\textless{}plot\_query\_value\textgreater{}}}.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simualtion\_API.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse.sim\_id}} must be
related to the Chen Lee system.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{project (simulation\_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee attribute)@\spxentry{project}\spxextra{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues_ChenLee.project}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{project}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = \textquotesingle{}project\textquotesingle{}}}}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{PlotQueryValues\_HO (class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas)@\spxentry{PlotQueryValues\_HO}\spxextra{class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues_HO}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues\_HO}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{value}}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enum.Enum}}

List of tags of each different plot generated automatically by the
backend when a Harmonic Oscillator simulation is requested.

These tags are used as the possible values of the querry param \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{value}}
in route \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/results/\{sim\_id\}/plot?value=\textless{}plot\_query\_value\textgreater{}}}.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simualtion\_API.controller.shcemas.SimIdResponse.sim\_id}} must be
related to the Harmonic Oscillator system.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{coord (simulation\_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues\_HO attribute)@\spxentry{coord}\spxextra{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues\_HO attribute}}

Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pydantic.main.BaseModel}}

Schema of the status of simulations.

This pydantic model is intended to store paths of results of the
simulations algong with some metadata. This information can be accessed via
GET in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/simulate/status/\{sim\_id\}}}.

\index{SimSystem (class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas)@\spxentry{SimSystem}\spxextra{class in simulation\_api.controller.schemas}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enum.Enum}}

List of available systems for simulation.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
The values of the attributes of this class must coincide with the
dictionary keys defined in
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulations}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulations}}}}}, otherwise the
system won’t be simulated by the backend.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
This class needs update each time a new simulation is added: add an
appropiate new attribute.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.system_to_params_dict}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{system\_to\_params\_dict}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = \{\textquotesingle{}Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee\sphinxhyphen{}Attractor\textquotesingle{}: \{\textquotesingle{}param0\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}a\textquotesingle{}, \textquotesingle{}param1\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}b\textquotesingle{}, \textquotesingle{}param2\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}c\textquotesingle{}\}, \textquotesingle{}Harmonic\sphinxhyphen{}Oscillator\textquotesingle{}: \{\textquotesingle{}param0\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}m\textquotesingle{}, \textquotesingle{}param1\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}k\textquotesingle{}\}\}}}}
Maps the name of each available system to its parameter change\sphinxhyphen{}of\sphinxhyphen{}convention
mapping (e.g. {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.params_mapping_HO}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{params\_mapping\_HO}}}}} or
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.params_mapping_ChenLee}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{params\_mapping\_ChenLee}}}}}.)

This is used to translate the parameters name convention in frontend simulation
request to the parameters name convention in backend simulation request (with
appropiate schema given by
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimRequest}}}}}.)

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks}}}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:module-simulation_api.controller.tasks}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation-api-controller-tasks}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!simulation\_api.controller.tasks@\spxentry{simulation\_api.controller.tasks}}\index{simulation\_api.controller.tasks@\spxentry{simulation\_api.controller.tasks}!module@\spxentry{module}}
This file will do background tasks e.g. the simulation
\index{\_api\_simulation\_request() (in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks)@\spxentry{\_api\_simulation\_request()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._api_simulation_request}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_api\_simulation\_request}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_system}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sim\_params}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{background\_tasks}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{starlette.background.BackgroundTasks}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{db}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}]{\sphinxcrossref{simulation\_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}}}}}
Requests simulation to BackgroundTasks.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_system}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}) \textendash{} System to be simulated.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_params}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimRequest}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimRequest}}}}}) \textendash{} Contains all the information about the simulation request.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{background\_tasks}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fastapi.BackgroundTasks}}) \textendash{} Object needed to request simulation in the background.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{db}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sqlalchemy.orm.Session}}) \textendash{} Needed for interaction with database.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxstylestrong{sim\_id\_response} \textendash{} Contains information about simulation request, such as simulation ID
and others. See
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimIdResponse}}}}} for more
information.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_check\_chen\_lee\_params() (in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks)@\spxentry{\_check\_chen\_lee\_params()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._check_chen_lee_params}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_check\_chen\_lee\_params}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{a}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{b}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{c}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}}{}
Checks that the set of Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee parameters satisfy chaotic conditions,
therefore bound solutions.

The conditions are
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}a > 0 \,\text{ and }\, b < 0 \,\text{ and }\, c < 0 \,\text{ and }\, a < - (b + c)\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This conditions are stated in \sphinxhref{https://doi.org/10.1142/S0218127403006509}{this reference}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{a}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} \(\omega_x\) parameter.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{b}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} \(\omega_y\) parameter.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{c}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} \(\omega_z\) parameter.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_pickle() (in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks)@\spxentry{\_pickle()}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.controller.tasks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._pickle}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_pickle}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{file\_name}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{path}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{data}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}dict\DUrole{p}{{]}}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ Any}}
Saves \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{data}} to pickle or reads Python object from pickle.

Saves \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{data}} to pickle if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{data}}. Otherwise it will try to read a
pickle from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{path + \textquotesingle{}/\textquotesingle{} + file\_name}} and return the python object stored
in it.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Name of file to be read from or to write on.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Path of directory in which the file will be saved or read from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{None}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} If you want to save data to a pickle, provide the data as dictionary.
Default is None.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{loaded\_object} \textendash{} Object loaded when no data is provided.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Any or None

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Generates relevant simulation’s plots and saves them.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sim\_results}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimResults}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimResults}}}}}) \textendash{} Simulation results as returned by
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.simulate}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulate()}}}}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{system}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}) \textendash{} System to be simulated.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plots\_basename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Base name of the plots. Actual name of each plot will be
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textless{}plotbasename\textgreater{}\_\textless{}plot\_query\_value\textgreater{}.png}}, where \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textless{}plot\_query\_value\textgreater{}}}
is a special tag for each type of plot. In this API, baseplot will
always be the value of
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimIdResponse.sim_id}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sim\_id}}}}}.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{plot\_query\_values} \textendash{} Names of each type of plot. These are very important since they are
needed to access the plots in the API route (these are the possible
values for the query param “value” in route
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/results/\{sim\_id\}/plot}}).

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
List{[}str{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection*{Notes}

The Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee Attractor is a dynamical system defined by:%
\begin{footnote}[1]\sphinxAtStartFootnote
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1142/S0218127403006509}
%
\end{footnote}
\begin{align*}\!\begin{aligned}
\frac{d\omega_x}{dt} &= - \omega_y \omega_z + a \, \omega_x\\
\frac{d\omega_y}{dt} &= \omega_z \omega_x + b \, \omega_y\\
\frac{d\omega_z}{dt} &= \frac{1}{3} \omega_x \omega_y + c \, \omega_z\\
\end{aligned}\end{align*}
Its origin is closely related to the motion of a rigid body in a rotating
frame of reference.

\subsubsection*{Notes}

The hamiltonian describing the Harmonic Oscillator is defined dy
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}H = \frac{1}{2m}p^2 + \frac{1}{2}k q^2\end{split}
\end{equation*}\index{\_\_init\_\_() (simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D method)@\spxentry{\_\_init\_\_()}\spxextra{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D method}}

Adds attributes
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D.m}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HarmonicOsc1D.m}}}}} and

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ini\_cndtn}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\_like}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{shape}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{2}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{,}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} Initial condition of 1D Harmonic Oscillator. Convention:
\(\texttt{ini_cndtn} = [q_0, p_0]\) where \(q_0\) is the initial
generalised position and \(p_0\) is the initial generalised
momentum. Default is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}0., 1.{]}}}. A list of initial conditions
can be used, in this case a list of solutions will be returned by
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.simulate}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulation.simulate()}}}}}.

    \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{k}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{float}\PYG{p}{,}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Force constant of harmonic oscilltor.}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Default is  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{"m": 1., "k": 1.\}}}.


\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D.dyn_sys_eqns}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dyn\_sys\_eqns}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{t}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ List\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}
Hamilton’s equations for 1D\sphinxhyphen{}Harmonic Oscillator.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Overwrites {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.dyn_sys_eqns}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulation.dyn\_sys\_eqns}}}}}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Time of evaluation of Hamilton’s equations.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\_like}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{shape}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{2}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{,}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} Canonical coordinates.
Convention: \(\texttt{y} = [q, p]\) where \(q\) is the
generalised position and \(p\) is the generalised momentum.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{dydt} \textendash{} Hamilton’s equations for 1D Harmonic Oscillator.
\(\texttt{dydt} = \left[ \frac{dq}{dt}, \frac{dp}{dt} \right] =
\left[ \frac{\partial H}{\partial p}, - \frac{\partial H}{\partial q} \right]\)

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
array\_like, shape (2,)

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{dyn\_sys\_eqns() (simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation method)@\spxentry{dyn\_sys\_eqns()}\spxextra{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.dyn_sys_eqns}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dyn\_sys\_eqns}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{t}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ List\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}
Trivial 2D dynamical system. Just for reference.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The actual simulations that inherit this class will replace this method
with the relevant dynamical equations.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{simulate() (simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation method)@\spxentry{simulate()}\spxextra{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.simulate}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{simulate}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ scipy.integrate.\_ivp.ivp.OdeResult}}
Simulates \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{self.system}} abstracted in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{self.dyn\_sys\_eqns}}
and using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode

\sphinxstylestrong{self.results} \textendash{}

Bunch object with the following fields defined:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{t}] \leavevmode{[}ndarray, shape (n\_points,){]}
Time points.

\item[{y}] \leavevmode{[}ndarray, shape (n, n\_points){]}
Values of the solution at t.

\item[{sol}] \leavevmode{[}OdeSolution or None{]}
Found solution as OdeSolution instance; None if
dense\_output was set to False.

\item[{t\_events}] \leavevmode{[}list of ndarray or None{]}
Contains for each event type a list of arrays at which an
event of that type event was detected. None if events was
None.

\item[{y\_events}] \leavevmode{[}list of ndarray or None{]}
For each value of t\_events, the corresponding value of the
solution. None if events was None.

\item[{nfev}] \leavevmode{[}int{]}
Number of evaluations of the right\sphinxhyphen{}hand side.

\item[{njev}] \leavevmode{[}int{]}
Number of evaluations of the Jacobian.

\item[{nlu}] \leavevmode{[}int{]}
Number of LU decompositions.

\item[{status}] \leavevmode{[}int{]}
Reason for algorithm termination: \sphinxhyphen{}1, Integration step
failed; 0, The solver successfully reached the end of
tspan; 1, A termination event occurred.

\item[{message}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Human\sphinxhyphen{}readable description of the termination reason.

\item[{success}] \leavevmode{[}bool{]}
True if the solver reached the interval end or a
termination event occurred (status \textgreater{}= 0).

\end{description}
\end{quote}


\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
OdeResult

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{system (simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation attribute)@\spxentry{system}\spxextra{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{Simulations (in module simulation\_api.simulation.simulations)@\spxentry{Simulations}\spxextra{in module simulation\_api.simulation.simulations}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulations}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulations}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = \{\textquotesingle{}Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee\sphinxhyphen{}Attractor\textquotesingle{}: \textless{}class \textquotesingle{}simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.ChenLeeAttractor\textquotesingle{}\textgreater{}, \textquotesingle{}Harmonic\sphinxhyphen{}Oscillator\textquotesingle{}: \textless{}class \textquotesingle{}simulation\_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D\textquotesingle{}\textgreater{}\}}}}
Maps the names of the available systems to their corresponding classes.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
Must be updated each time a new simulation is added (add the new relevant item
to the dictionary).
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsubsection{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api:submodules}}

\paragraph{simulation\_API.config module}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.config:module-simulation_api.config}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.config:simulation-api-config-module}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.config::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!simulation\_api.config@\spxentry{simulation\_api.config}}\index{simulation\_api.config@\spxentry{simulation\_api.config}!module@\spxentry{module}}
General configurations of our API.


\subsection{Add a new simulation}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:add-a-new-simulation}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:code-new-simulation}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation::doc}}
Keep in mind that the systems we can add to our API are those that can be
integrated by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scipy.integrate.solve\_ivp}}. Those are basically first order
coupled differential equations i.e. systems of the form
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\frac{d\mathbf{y}}{dt} = \mathbf{f}(\mathbf{y}, t).\end{split}
\end{equation*}
If you want to add a new simulation to this API just follow the steps described
below.


\subsubsection{1. Add the simulation to \sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{simulations}} module}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:add-the-simulation-to-simulations-module}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Add a relevant class to {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:module-simulation_api.simulation.simulations}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulations}}}}}.
This class will define the relevant parameters used in the simulation as well
as its dynamic equations. It must inherit
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulation}}}}}
and must have the same structure as
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.HarmonicOsc1D}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HarmonicOsc1D}}}}} and
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.ChenLeeAttractor}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ChenLeeAttractor}}}}}. Don’t
forget to test your simulation by playing around in
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:module-simulation_api.simulation.demo_run_simulation}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{demo\_run\_simulation}}}}}.

\item {} 
Don’t forget to add the attribute
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.system}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{system}}}}} to your
class. The value of this attribute must be the name of the system separated
by dashes. Use only alphanumerical characters and dashes.

\item {} 
Add the relevant simulation class you just created to the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}}
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulations}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulations}}}}}. This will tell
the API that the simulation exists and it is available.

\end{enumerate}


\subsubsection{2. Add relevant schemas and models to \sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{schemas}}}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:add-relevant-schemas-and-models-to-schemas}}\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:new-simulation-schemas}}
Follow the steps mentioned below \textendash{}some of them may not make sense at first
glance, but until you write the code.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Add the {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:simulation_api.simulation.simulations.Simulation.system}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{system}}}}}
attribute value of the recently created class to
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem}}}}}.

\item {} 
Create a class that inherits {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimForm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimForm}}}}}.
It must be similar to {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.HOSimForm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HOSimForm}}}}}
and {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.ChenLeeSimForm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ChenLeeSimForm}}}}}. This class
will be used to check the simulation information provided in frontend.

\item {} 
Add a relevant item \textendash{}related to the class created in the last numeral\textendash{} to the
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimFormDict}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimFormDict}}}}}. This will
map the name of the system to its simulation form model.

\item {} 
Add a new class similar to {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.HOParams}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HOParams}}}}}
and {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.ChenLeeParams}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ChenLeeParams}}}}}. The names
of the attributes must match the names of the parameters defined in the
relevant simulation class, created in the first numeral of this list.

\item {} 
Add an appropiate item to the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}}
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.SimSystem_to_SimParams}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimSystem\_to\_SimParams}}}}}.

\item {} 
Create an appropiate \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} similar to
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.params_mapping_HO}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{params\_mapping\_HO}}}}} and
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.params_mapping_ChenLee}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{params\_mapping\_ChenLee}}}}}.

\item {} 
Add an appropiate item to the dict
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.system_to_params_dict}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{system\_to\_params\_dict}}}}}.

\item {} 
Create a new class similar to
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues_HO}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues\_HO}}}}} and
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues_ChenLee}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues\_ChenLee}}}}}.

\item {} 
Add an appropiate item to {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.PlotQueryValues}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues}}}}}.

\end{enumerate}

If you do not understand some of the steps above or how to implement them, refer
to {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api:code-api-package}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{the documentaton}}}} of the relevant classes or schemas
for the already available systems \textendash{}Chen\sphinxhyphen{}Lee Attractor or Harmonic Oscillator\textendash{},
it may enlighten you.


\subsubsection{3. Add relevant plots to \sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{\_plot\_solution()}}}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:add-relevant-plots-to-plot-solution}}
Here you can add two or three intersting plots related to the simulation you
just added and tested. The code that generates the plots must be placed in
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._plot_solution}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller.tasks.\_plot\_solution()}}}}}.

A few things to take into account:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
We use matplotlib, but we use the class \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Figure}} directly, we do not use
pyplot. This is related to some problems that may arise with the pyplot
package and the web applocation backend, as mentioned in
\sphinxhref{https://matplotlib.org/faq/howto\_faq.html\#how-to-use-matplotlib-in-a-web-application-server}{matplotlib’s documentation}.

\item {} 
Note that the plots related to the simulations are defined in an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{if}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{elif}} block each one. Add a new block for the simulation you want to add.

\item {} 
The first two lines of code that generate each plot related to the recently
created simulation must look something like:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}value} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{PlotQueryValues\PYGZus{}HO}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{phase}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{value}
\PYG{n}{plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}values}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}value}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For each generated plot, we define a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_value}} that comes directly
from the class defined in item number 8 of the
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:new-simulation-schemas}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{last section}}}}. In the example given above,
the class was named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PlotQueryValues\_HO}}, the attribute related to the
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_value}} of the relevant plot was named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{coord}} and the value
of the latter is accessed by using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.value}}.
Each \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_value}} is appended to the list \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_query\_values}},
which is the return value of {\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.tasks._plot_solution}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_plot\_solution()}}}}}.
This item is very important, since the values we define here are used to name
the plots as well as to look them up.

\item {} 
Finally, the last line of code that generates each plot must be:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{fig}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{savefig}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}create\PYGZus{}plot\PYGZus{}path\PYGZus{}disk}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{plots\PYGZus{}basename}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{plot\PYGZus{}query\PYGZus{}value}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

This will ensure that the name of the plot has always the same format

\end{enumerate}


\subsubsection{4. Add relevant form entries in frontend}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:add-relevant-form-entries-in-frontend}}
Modify appropiately the template \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api/templates/request\sphinxhyphen{}simulation.html}}.
This template is the one that asks for the simulation parameters in the frontend.

Some things to take into account:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Note that each system has its own \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{if}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{elif}} block. Stick to this
convention and add a new block related to the new simulation (the new system).

\item {} 
In the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{if}} block mentioned above there are only two main things the form
should ask for: initial conditions and parameters of simulation.

\item {} 
For the initial conditions the value of the HTML attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name}} should start
with the string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"ini"}} followed by the index in the initial condition
array defined in your simulation class attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ini\_cndtn}}.
For example, for the harmonic oscillator the convention of initial condition
is \(\texttt{ini_cndtn} = [q_0, p_0]\). So, \(q_0\) will be associated
with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name="ini0"}} and \(p_0\) with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name="ini1"}}.

\item {} 
Analogous to the initial condition convention mentioned in the last
item, you must choose an arbitrary convention for the names of the parameters
of each specific system but you should stick to this convention when defining
the models and schemas associated to the parameters and mentioned in
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:new-simulation-schemas}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{the previous to last section}}}}.
Specifically, you should stick to the convention you define here and follow
it in item number 6 of the previous to last section. For example, in the
Harmonic Oscillator we chose the convention of associating the parameter
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{m}} with the HTML attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name="param0"}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{k}} with
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name="param1"}}. You can check that
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api/templates/request\sphinxhyphen{}simulation.html}} as well as
{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:simulation_api.controller.schemas.params_mapping_HO}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{params\_mapping\_HO}}}}} follow this
convention.

\end{enumerate}


\subsubsection{5. Modify \sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{results.html}} template to show results}
\label{\detokenize{code_docs/new_simulation:modify-results-html-template-to-show-results}}
Finally, we need to add a relevant \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{elif}} block to the template
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api/templates/results.html}}. This template should show the
generated plots, give the option to download them with a button and
give the option to download the pickle file as well.
\begin{description}
\item[{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api:module-simulation_api}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api}}}}}}] \leavevmode
Initialization of web application.
\begin{description}
\item[{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.controller:module-simulation_api.controller}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.controller}}}}}}] \leavevmode
The core package of our API. Here you can find the main app, schemas and
background tasks.

\item[{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.model:module-simulation_api.model}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.model}}}}}}] \leavevmode
Database\sphinxhyphen{}related package.

\item[{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.simulation:module-simulation_api.simulation}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.simulation}}}}}}] \leavevmode
Simulation\sphinxhyphen{}related package. Here you can find all the programs we use to
simulate the available systems.

\item[{{\hyperref[\detokenize{code_docs/simulation_api.config:module-simulation_api.config}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulation\_api.config}}}}}}] \leavevmode
Configuration module. Some very basic configurations of our web application.

\end{description}

\end{description}
